articles.description: Howard Webb defended refereeing standards in the Premier League with a review of recent incidents.
articles.title: Howard Webb defends Premier League refereeing standards

articles.description: Champions League: Schalke, relegation and oblivion
articles.title: Champions League: Schalke, relegation and oblivion

articles.description: With 700 Real Madrid games and 39 titles between them, BBC Sport's Andy West explains why Lucas Vazquez and Nacho deserve more praise.
articles.title: Lucas Vazquez & Nacho: Real Madrid's unsung heroes ready to be called on again

articles.description: Ronnie O’Sullivan cuts a frustrated figure despite coming from 3-1 down to end the opening session of his World Championship quarter-final level at 4-4 with Stuart Bingham.
articles.title: Snooker World Championships: Ronnie O'Sullivan level with Stuart Bingham in quarter-final

articles.description: Top seed Iga Swiatek fights back from a set down to beat Beatriz Haddad Maia and book her place in the Madrid Open semi-finals.
articles.title: Madrid Open: Iga Swiatek beats Beatriz Haddad Maia to reach semis

articles.description: Belgium goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois will miss Euro 2024 following a knee ligament injury despite a potential return for Real Madrid.
articles.title: Thibaut Courtois: Belgium goalkeeper ruled out of Euro 2024

articles.description: The United States and Mexico withdraw their joint bid to host the 2027 Women's World Cup to focus on bidding for the tournament in 2031.
articles.title: 2027 Women's World Cup: USA & Mexico withdraw bid

articles.description: US athletes write to the country’s drug tsar asking for a “truly independent investigation” into 23 Chinese swimmers who competed at the Tokyo Games despite testing positive for a banned drug.
articles.title: Wada: US athletes call for 'truly independent investigation' into Chinese swimmers' failed tests

articles.description: Open Championship 2024: Royal Troon to have longest hole
articles.title: Open Championship 2024: Royal Troon to have longest hole

articles.description: England forward Maro Itoje could miss Saracens' Premiership run-in after being cited for a dangerous tackle.
articles.title: Saracens' Maro Itoje faces ban after being cited for dangerous tackle
